bookCover.coverDescription:
Welcome to Compass, this is all generating awareness of the amazing range of technologies that are available to all students in DCU. The technologies range from tools within your:

  • DCU Goggle student account

  • DCU Microsoft account

  • A tool called Sensus Access

  • and services that impart technology skills to you.

Compass is all about supporting you to navigate these technologies and services so you can settle into your student journey. We'll give you tips about how these DCU technologies can help with:

  • different ways to use technology for reading

  • choices about how you can write an essay with technology

  • Ways to use technology to stay organised.

  • Signposting you to technology-linked services so you can get help and technology skills.

params.text:
A Lodestar to find your way

A big welcome to Lodestar - our guide to help you navigate inclusive technologies here on your FET journey. In Lodestar, we will show you tips and videos about these tools and technologies that can help with reading, writing, organisation and a lot more.

How to use Lodestar?

To use each page of Lodestar is easy. There is an image in each page and in each image is a yellow hotspot.

Select the yellow 'hot spot' to reveal information, text in this example. Try it.

Selecting to reveal information

Compass unlocks information to you when you select the yellow icons. This information can be in the form of:

  1. Text - useful information about Inclusive Technology.
  2. Later in will revel images and videos - go to the page to try this.

Lodestar has options

Inclusive technology gives you choice about how you engage, interact and create information for college work. Compass gives you choice too, about how you learn about these technologies.

Tip: Select the yellow icons to reveal text or an image or a video

Lodestar is all about supporting you to navigate these technologies and services so you can settle into your student journey. We'll give you tips about how these technologies can help with:

  • different ways to use technology for reading, writing and organisation

  • choices about how you can write an essay with technology

  • Ways to use technology to stay organised.

  • Signposting you to websites that an give you more information.

Images can help some people to learn effectively. That is why we have them in Lodestar and in this case we want to draw your attention to how the 3 yellow hot sports will be in the same order in all the images that are in Compass.

  • 1st hotsptop on the left - Text to explain.
  • 2nd hotspot in the middle - Image and text.
  • 3rd hotshop on the right - Video and text.

params.text: A short video with tips about how to get the best of the Lodestar experience.

Why should we have choice?

We all learn and create in different ways so having a ways of working helps us to get the best out of ourselves. Technology gives us choice about how we can undertake day to day tasks so getting information about these technologies empowers us.

Choice is a key part of Universal Deign for Learning (UDL) so UDL has has informed the content (technology giving you choice) and has informed how the information is laid out (text or images or video).

Tip: Select the yellow icons to reveal text or an image or a video

Universal Design for Learning (UDL) is a set of principles for curriculum development that give all individuals equal opportunities to learn, including Students with Disabilities.

UDL aims to improve the educational experience of all students by introducing more flexible methods of teaching, assessment and service provision to cater for the diversity of learners in our classrooms.

Inclusive Technologies support choice and diversity.

hotspots.header: What is Universal Design for Learning (UDL)?

params.alt: UDL Guidelines - multiple means of engagement, representaion and expression
params.title: UDL Guidelines

params.text:
The UDL guidelines are based on the idea that there is no such thing as a ‘typical’ or ‘average’ student, that all students learn differently and that to successfully teach for all students, we have to introduce greater flexibility in to teaching and learning practice. They say that educators should follow 3 core principles when designing learning experiences, building in:

  1. Multiple means of engagement - interact with students in diverse ways.
  2. Multiple means of representation - diverse types of content that connect with different learners.
  3. Multiple means of action or expression - to ask learners to express their learning in diverse ways and offer choice in how they express their knowledge.

params.text:
Inclusive Technology is one way you can choose to interact with content.

  • Instead of reading, you can have information read aloud.
  • Instead of handwriting or typing you can use dictation.
  • Instead of a paper organizer you can use your Google Calendar.

Choice is key for you to succeed - Compass will inform your choices so now engage with the content and explore your learning preferences.
